snippet: The economy is too weak to justify easing up on supportive policies like multibillion-dollar bond purchases.
abstract: Editorial praises Federal Reserve decision to hold off reducing the multibillion-dollar bond purchases that are central to its efforts to spur the economy; says decision also indicates Fed is giving due consideration to fostering both stability and full employment; criticizes Congress for failing to address problems that are not primarily the Fed's to solve, like creating jobs, raising wages, increasing taxes on the wealthy and expanding the safety net.
lead_paragraph: The economy is too weak to justify easing up on supportive policies like multibillion-dollar bond purchases.

headline.main: Staying the Course at the Fed
headline.print_headline: Staying the Course at the Fed
